description: Numbers n such that phi(n)+sigma(n) is a prime.
comments: Indices n such that A065387(n) is a prime number. [_R. J. Mathar_, Aug 26 2009]All terms are squares or twice squares (A028982). - _Donovan Johnson_, Sep 27 2013
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = isprime(eulerphi(n) + sigma(n)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 27 2013(PARI) v=vector(1000); c=0; for(j=1, 12105, m=j^2; if(isprime(eulerphi(m)+sigma(m)), c++; v[c]=m)); for(j=1, 8559, m=2*j^2; if(isprime(eulerphi(m)+sigma(m)), c++; v[c]=m)); v=vecsort(v); for(n=1, 1000, write("b038344.txt", n " " v[n])) \\ _Donovan Johnson_, Sep 27 2013
author: _Felice Russo_
